introduction: This video discusses the human side of technology and how it can improve our interactions with devices and technology. It explores the field of human-computer interaction (HCI) and its impact on our daily lives.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to HCI
content: Explanation of human-computer interaction as a field of study.
Discussion on the importance of HCI in designing technology that meets individual needs.
Overview of the latest research in HCI.
Introduction to the speakers and their areas of expertise.

sections.title: Section 2: Mary Serwinski's Work in HCI
content: Presentation of Mary Serwinski and her work in HCI.
Discussion on her latest projects focused on perception, interaction, and cognition.
Explanation of her use of machine learning to detect objects and gestures.
Overview of her work on Expressive Pixels, a technologymediated creativity toolkit.

sections.title: Section 3: Ken Hinckley's Work in HCI
content: Introduction of Ken Hinckley and his work in HCI.
Discussion on his research on sensing techniques, cross-device interaction, and novel device form factors.
Explanation of his work on Surface Fleet, a technology that helps make sense of complex work lives and interactions.
Overview of his visit to Microsoft during the pandemic remote work time.
topics: Cross-Device Interaction and Novel Device Form Factors

sections.title: Section 4: The Importance of HCI in Everyday Life
content: Discussion on how HCI impacts our daily lives, especially in the context of remote work and limited workspaces.
Explanation of how HCI allows us to extend our workspaces and leverage multiple devices for better productivity and creativity.
Overview of the challenges faced by individuals in balancing work and personal life during the pandemic.
Discussion on the future of HCI and its role in shaping our interactions with technology.
topics: Balancing Work and Personal Life during the Pandemic

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Next Steps
content: Summary of the key takeaways from the presentation.
Discussion on the potential of HCI to revolutionize the way we interact with technology.
Overview of the ongoing research and development in HCI.
Call to action for individuals and organizations to embrace HCI in their technology design processes.
topics: Ongoing Research and Development in HCI
